bibl.title: Junichi Yamamoto v. Luther Weedin. Order to Show Cause
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF JUNICHI YAMAMOTO FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS

This cause coming on for hearing upon the petition of Junichi Yamamoto for a writ of habeas corpus directed to Luther Weedin, United States Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, and the court having read said petition and being fully advised in the premises,

NOW THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED that Luther Weedin, United States Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, be and he is hereby directed to show cause before this court on the 13th day of March, 1922, at ten o'clock A.M., why a writ of habeas corpus should not issue by this court direct- ing the said Luther Weedin as such United States Commissioner of Immigration, to discharge the said petitioner from custody.

IT IS FURTHERMORE ORDERED that said Luther Weedin, United States Commissioner of Immigration be and he is hereby directed to release the said Junichi Yamamoto from his custody upon the filing by the said Junichi Yamamoto with the clerk of the above entitled court, of a bond in the penal sum of One Thousand Dollars with surety or sureties to be approved by the clerk of this court and conditioned that the said Junichi Yama- moto will surrender himself to the custody of said commissioner of Immigration when he shall be directed to do so by this court.
DONE in open court this 9th day of March, 1922.
